headline: Slow Cooker Ham
description: Slow cooker ham is juicy and delicious with this no-fuss recipe that's perfect for holiday meals. A bone-in ham and brown sugar are all you need for this sensational meal.

video.name: How to Make Slow Cooker Ham

name: Slow Cooker Ham

recipeInstructions.text: Spread about 1 1/2 cups of brown sugar on the bottom of a slow cooker.
Place ham on the brown sugar with the flat side facing down; you might have to trim it a little to make it fit.
Use your hands to rub the remaining brown sugar onto the ham.
Cover, and cook on Low for 8 hours.

review.reviewBody: This was a great, tender ham. I had a 4.5 lb ham, so only used about 1 cup of brown sugar and cooked on low for about 3 hours. I basted with the juices after about 1.5 hours. We also added about a cup of crushed pineapple which I sprinkled over the top of the ham.

My family likes a bit more zest.. I add a tablespoon of dry mustard powder and a teaspoon of smoked paprika to the brown sugar and put a layer of pineapple rings on the bottom of the crock, I have never had anything but moist meat with TONS of flavor.
I made this with the ham, 2 cups of brown sugar, and a small can of crushed pineapple in 100% juice. It looks amazing and smells even better. I cannot wait to taste it!
nice way to heat up ham at Easter without having to use the oven. Good recipe.

The video offers information that is not included in the recipe. Good idea to watch that first, to avoid ham issues that some had. Also, if your slow cooker runs hot like mine does, even on the low setting, you might want to add some liquid to it to keep it from burning or drying out.
I used a 9-pound smoked ham and cooked it in the crock-pot on Low for about 3 1/2 hours. It came out great!

So easy and it was delicious. I had a 9-10 pound Cooks butt ham and it took 5 1/2 hours in the slow cooker on low. I only used a cup of Splenda brown sugar (sprinkled some in the bottom of slow cooker and patted the rest on the ham). I put a can of sliced pineapple with juice on and around the ham. Ham was very tender. My whole family loved it.

Great Recipe. Ridiculously simple.
I added Whole cloves (@18) and used my injector every 2.5 hrs to inject that juice and baste the outside. REALLY good!
I like to add a half cup of root beer because it caramelizes the brown sugar and adds a great taste.
Easy way to free up the oven at holidays or enjoy a ham in the summer. I put some pineapple rings on the ham the last 90 minutes.
I make this for Easter brunch and it is delicious! So easy to make and allows more time to prepare the rest of the meal. Just make sure the ham you use is not spiral cut.
Very good. Will make again
I will never make a ham with a different recipe - delicious, juicy and beyond easy.
So easy!!!

The ham was tender, juicy and delicious. I did use a can of Dole Crushed Pineapple with the brown sugar in the bottom of the crockpot as well as using the brown sugar and pineapple juice poured over the ham to cook.

Delicious as written but I had to adjust the time. Only took 4 hours for my 10lb ham to be done. Any more and it would have been dried out! Also, consider adding pineapple juice for extra flavor. Yum!

This was delicious and easy. I was tasked with making the ham for our Christmas party at work. I was super worried that it wouldn't turn out very good as this was the first ham I'd ever made myself. 
My coworkers LOVED it!
The flavor was wonderful and they especially loved how it just fell apart like pulled pork. It is perfect for sandwiches and my boss ended up using a couple of rolls to make one. 
I just used a 7.5 pound smoked, bone-in ham and cooked it for the full 8 hours. It was very tender and juicy.
Definitely recommend this recipe as it is written!!

For a 9lb ham, 3.5 hours was too long. Maybe 2.5 hours would be perfect.
I added pineapple juice and honey to the brown sugar, studded the ham with cloves and draped with pineapple rings. If I had added enough juice to cover the bulk of the ham and decreased the cooking time, this would be 100% entertainment worthy.
I made this and it turned out fantastic. I did add in a shot of Makers Mark which gave it a nice flavor from the bourbon. This is my favorite way to cook a ham when I need the oven space.
Easy and sooo delicious!! Never had such a yummy tasting ham... did this for a family gathering... and everyone loved it!!
One of the easiest and best hams I have made. Thank you!

Was excited to try this super easy recipe. I used a 7.5 pound ham on the bone. The recipe says 8 hours on low. I only let mine cook 5 hours on low and it was very dry. Disappointed. If I try it again I’ll only cook it 2-3 hours.

This was really good! I loved that it only took 2 ingriedients. Fix it and forget it. I think I would like to add some pineapple, and maybe some cloves next time. Also, The part of the ham that was above the juice was a little tough. I might try to flip it halfway through.

The slow cooker does absolute wonders with a ham like this! There were some chunks of ham that ended up with a different texture-- I suppose these pieces were covered with the brown sugar and were in just the right hot spots. Overall, a very good recipe though.
The recipe was very delicious the ham just fell apart
I would recommend this recipe to everyone who wants a great tasting ham with little effort.

Followed recipe exactly. The result was a burnt looking ham that fell apart when I tried to slice it. My family described it as "pulled ham". Would never try this recipe again and caution others not to use it.
Super easy and super delicious!
The best ham we have ever had!! Bonus, it's so easy!!!

I use 2 ingredients as well but it's the ham and frozen pineapple juice. Don't dilute the juice. Put some of the frozen pineapple juice on bottom then put the remainder on top. I like to continue cooking the juice until it is pretty dark (your preference). Cut and serve using juice like an jus.

The ONLY way I'll EVER cook a ham again. Have made this a dozen times and each time, perfect. I generalIy make a large ham so am not ablel to use the lid; no problem. Just cover tightly with heavy duty aluminum foil and it works great. Do not remove foil just pop a thermometer through the foil for temperature. Put the large flat carving part of the ham face down in the crock-pot. It also frees up your oven for other cooking. Simple slam dunk recipe for a beautiful juicy ham dinner.
Delicious...
Overcooked. Next time I'll cut some time.
It's more difficult to find a ham that isn't spiral cut, but completely worth it. I made it exactly as written. It was tender and juicy!

Wonderful! I started with the 1 1/2 c. of brown sugar in the bottom, but because I like pineapple, I opened a can of sliced pineapple in juice (not syrup), and poured the juice from the can over the ham just before packing the ham with the brown sugar. Then I stuck the rings on with toothpicks (note to self: use non-colored toothpicks). Not salty at all. Falls off the bone!

I found that using the suggested cook time, the ham dried out & was nearly burned. I love the recipe otherwise as much for its' simplicity as anything. I made a glaze with Michigan tart cherry preserves, honey and brown sugar & that rejuvenated the ham quite a bit. I'll simply adjust the cook time in future.
I didn't use a picnic ham but this was the easiest way to cook a ham. Extremely good!
Interesting twist to making Ham. I added clove for additional flavor. Will definitely make ham this way again

Very quick and easy, just the way I like. Turned out moist and delicious. Just added some cloves with the brown sugar. The house smelled really good. Served it for New Year’s Eve dinner and the only thing that was left on the platter was the bone. This will be the only way to cook ham for me.
Couldn’t have been any easier! Put it in the crock pot at night-ready by am! I got so many compliments and it definitely beat the turkey!
I don’t eat meat but made this for my family and it looked very unappetizing and not sure my family liked the taste. Just wasn’t a hit with my family.

Used an 8lb spiral cut boneless ham, added a can of pineapple chunks without the juice, and a little ground cloves on top, covered it with foil and after 4 hours it was perfect! Nice and juicy and not dried out at all... like the other comments if you use a spiral cut you definitely need to cut the cooking time way down!

Ham was so tender but cautious don't over cook, especially if you add the pineapple's and juice like I do. It takes the smoke right out of the ham if you do with the pineapple juice and cooking a few more hours because we were waiting for our guests to arrive. I guess many people believe Thanksgiving dinner isn't ready when they arrive, but if I say noon everything is done at 11:45.
Easy,easy,easy
WOW, so easy and so good and moist
It domes out perfect every time.
Delicious flavor! I cooked ham in crockpot on Low for 5 hours.
Delish, I used a Smithfield butt. Don't like a lot of additives as I use the bone and unappealing pieces, freezing them for future use, green beans, collards or dried beans.
What a simple trick to perk up plain ham! I've used this with ham steaks too. Rub a light layer of brown sugar on top of each slice. For a crowd, you can layer slices in a roaster and bake that way.
This is so simple and so amazing!!!!! I brought it to a church gathering and the plate was cleaned!!!! It couldn't get more easier.
Didn't fit in my crock pot so I covered with tin foil. Basted a few times during cooking time and everyone at the party LOVED it!

This was really good.I only used about 1 1/2 cups of brown sugar and like others I was worried about no liquid so added 1/2 cup of chicken broth. Next time I won't add the broth because it isn't needed. My new recipe for ham!
Used regular brown sugar and it was awesome.
Succulent, delicious, so perfect EXACTLY by the recipe with no changes. My whole family raved! I won't make ham any other way from here on out.
Simple Easy Delicious
This recipe is so delicious and easy.....baked for 5 hours and the ham turned out nice and moist

Was a great recipe for a holiday when there was variation in the menu for those who wanted something different, also made Baked Salmon w/ Herb Sauce. Ham turned out great, tender and good in time specified - added crushed pineapple to the recipe. Recommend this recipe!!

Was delicious! I added a can a chunky pineapple, with the brown sugar. Crock pot 10 hours. Will make again.
Thank you.
I will make it again had it, on low while went to church on Easter., my company thought it very good.

My hubby and I were skeptical, but we felt it was worth the try. We made it for Easter, and everyone couldn't believe it was made from a slow cooker, including myself. I'll be making this more often since it's so easy. We had an 8lb Farmer John bone in ham ($10 sale) on low for 6 hours. We did baste it with it's own juices every hour, but that's optional, we were paranoid and decided to go a little extra to make sure it was yummy.
Best ham I’ve ever made. I didn’t change a thing. I added the pineapple and ground cloves as suggested.

Great recipe that I will made again. The cooking time is way off though. I had a 8 pound skinless Hickory Smoked bone in Butt that I cooked on high for 1 hour and 3 on low to perfection. Thanks for sharing your recipe.
Making this now, it smells sooo good!
8 hours is way too long! It got mushy.
I have made it a few times. It comes out amazing!!

Fabulous recipe! I have used it several times. Please do not forgot to keep an eye on it. I burned it up by getting busy with other things on Christmas. It was not a good day for me. If your ham says fully cooked it needs to be warmed to temp, but not cooked. Don't get too busy you are not keeping an eye on this ham in the crock pot. I would suggest low setting and then warm. When I cooked it properly my brother in law said it was one of the best hams he had ever tasted, and he is not free with compliments with me.

Fabulous recipe! I have used it several times. Please do not forgot to keep an eye on it. I burned it up by getting busy with other things on Christmas. It was not a good day for me. If your ham says fully cooked it needs to be warmed to temp, but not cooked. Don't get too busy you are not keeping an eye on this ham in the crock pot. I would suggest low setting and then warm. When I cooked it properly my brother in law said it was one of the best hams he had ever tasted, and he is not free with compliments with me.
This was so easy and turned out great. My husband is diabetic so I only used 3/4 c of brown sugar...(2/4 for the bottom and 1/4 for the rub) I cooked 5lbs for 6hrs on low.
This was very simple to make, and saved me time and oven space on Christmas.
Edible but tasteless and ugly , not sure what went wrong but it was terrible thank goodness there was other food.

Super easy! I'm a vegetarian, but my family, especially kids, love ham. I'm so glad I found this and made it! Even my super picky nephew requested this as leftover meals. I took another's tip and added a small can of pineapple juice.
I made this for my family twice and it was a HUGE hit!!! Both times I used smoked hams which I thought would be bad but, I think that those hams were the best hams I've ever had!!
This was excellent! The only thing I added was a squirt of honey and a little orange-pineapple juice. My husband took it to work for a Christmas lunch and his co-workers loved it.
Simply, delicious and easy.
extremely easy and tasty recipe. my family loved it more than I thought they would, and I overcooked it. 8 hours was a little long in my crock pot.
Easy recipe, but nothing to blow your socks off.
I rated this 4 stars for simplicity. It was tastey, but a tad too sweet for me. Glad I tried it!

I used a 10.5 lb bone in pre-cooked ham. I rubbed the ham with approximately 3/4 cup brown sugar and placed approximately 1 1/4 cup in the bottom. I placed the ham face down as directed. The lid wouldn't fit so I covered the slow cooker with aluminum foil I cooked it on low for 6 hours and it came out so juicy and great! So easy!! I will never cook a ham any other way. Thank you! Everyone loved it!
I used an 8lb butt portion and only cooked it 5hrs. Best Ham ever and so simple!!
I made this for my wife and I last night for Thanksgiving. It was absolutely amazing and so easy to make. We will definitely be using this recipe again.

I have made this ham a couple times now and I love it! It's so easy, no fuss. I love how I can free up my oven by making it in the crock. It tastes amazing. Just a little bit of sweetness along with salty of the meat, very tender, too. Use the bone in a pot of beans. Excellent recipe in every respect. Thank you for posting it!

This is the 4th time I have made a ham this way so I can say, with confidence, that the results are superbly tender and tasty....perhaps the best ham I have ever had. one small caution: Don't cook TOO long. 8 hours on low is quite long enough for a 9 or 10 lb smoked, uncut butt portion, or maybe even 6 or 7 hours. Longer hours result in a darker, drier meat that shreds too easily and is still tasty but less succulent. My best results for the same sized ham were achieved with 2 hours on High + 2 hours on Low OR 6 hours on low. This makes such a great and easy meal. Sliced leftovers freeze well, too!
I can't believe how easy this recipe is and it turns out delicious and perfect every time.

I've made our hams like this for a l-o-n-g time now ;) sometimes we add pineapple also!
I like it plain, but John loves the pineapple kind lol
It's soooo easy for anyone, new cooks or ones that have been cooking for years! :)

This is so easy! I have made it with just the brown sugar. I have also mixed a few squirts of Dijon mustard and a can of whole jellied cranberries with the brown sugar that is added on top to jazz it up. It was good both times. This is a good, easy Sunday ham to prepare. This last time I cooked it on high 2 hours and low 1 hour. I switched it to low just when I put my cheesy potatoes in the oven and the timing was perfect. This was delicious with steamed carrots and green beans, and the cheesy potatoes. This is my go-to method for preparing an inexpensive ($8) bone-in shank cut ham that Aldi carries during the colder season.
my family loved it with some mashed sweet potatos and peas,i cooked it about all day it was so yummy and yet so simple.
Too easy !
Very easy and flavorful. Meat was moist.
I've made this twice for holidays and it is awesome. So easy, so good, and leaves the oven for other things. Win win right there!

This is for Debbym: 
A picnic ham is a cut of pork taken from the pig's front legs, and it includes part of the shoulder. While a true ham may be on or off the bone, a picnic ham is traditionally on the bone. Picnic hams do taste a bit more like ham than other pork cuts because they're smoked.Jan 1, 2016.
It was EXCELLENT..
Yum! Did a 6 lb. bone in fully cooked ham in 4 1/2 hrs on low. Wonderful and so much better than using the oven in Florida in the summer!
The only thing I did different was add whole cloves to it before covering it with Brown Sugar.
I made the ham exactly as recipe stated. It was so juicy and tender and flavorful that when I make it again I'll do it the same again! So easy. Many compliments. Delicious!
It came out great!

Best ever. Only one thing recipe does not say frozen or thawed ham. 

I had a thawed ham so it was well done. Might be why it was sooooooo delic!
way to sweet cook time should be reduced
Will definitely make this again! Used this for our Easter ham and is was so moist, tender and had a wonderful flavor. Leftovers didn't even last very long!

I just made this ham for Easter, and it turned out great! It's a wonderful option for freeing up the oven for all of the sides. I had already bought my smoked, spiral sliced ham before I read all of the recommendations to NOT use this type of ham!! It actually turned out fine. I had a 9 lb ham -- next time I will get an 8 lb ham -- because it just barely fit in the crockpot. I did use the advice of others who said that the lid didn't fit on theirs as well so they wrapped aluminum foil around the top and sides. I did this and it seemed to work fine. I also cut the total time -- I cooked it on low for 4 hours. I didn't baste it b/c I was too lazy to undo the foil!! But the ham turned out juicy and hot and everybody loved it!! I will definitely use this recipe again but my changes will be: slightly smaller ham and cook on low for 3 hours instead of 4.
